poem:
Virtual Harbors

The keys hum,
whispers of longing 
in the glow of screens,
where the heart's distance
narrows -
past conservative roots,
still growing,
a touch unfelt,
yet known,
in the virtual harbors
of modern love
where guilt,
like old clothes,
is shed
for intimacy
at last.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Most of the flirting is virtual – you sit at a computer and talk to girls online’: This is how we do it in China Tao, 39 After seven years together, we’ve started to have great sex. It’s taken time to shed my sexual guilt Chen is 10 years younger than me, but she is much more sexually experienced. I was born in 1985, in the Anhui province of China, to a very conservative family.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Most of the flirting is virtual – you sit at a computer and talk to girls online’: This is how we do it in China Tao, 39 After seven years together, we’ve started to have great sex. It’s taken time to shed my sexual guilt Chen is 10 years younger than me, but she is much more sexually experienced. I was born in 1985, in the Anhui province of China, to a very conservative family.
